settings.title: Laser Hair Removal FAQs

tabs.tab_title: Does laser hair removal work on all skin types?
tabs.tab_content:
Unlike with hair color, laser hair removal does work on most skin types. This is thanks to new technologies that expand the breadth of laser hair removal possibilities!
 
For example, for darker skin, one needs a wavelength that gets rid of the hair in the root. However, if you do have a darker skin tone, be sure to consult with your doctor. This is to avoid chances of the laser targeting the skin pigment.

It really isn't. It is a very comfortable and safe treatment. However, some people are more sensitive than others, so you may experience some discomfort. On the other hand, our cooling system soothes the skin so the treatment does not cause any discomfort.

tabs.tab_title: How often should I schedule my sessions?
tabs.tab_content: Initially laser hair removal treatments are scheduled between 4 to 8 weeks. However, it all depends on the area to be treated.

tabs.tab_title: How many sessions do I need?
tabs.tab_content: Most areas require 3 to 5 treatments applied at intervals of 4 to 8 weeks to achieve the desired results.
You may experience redness and swelling. In some cases a slight burn or blister. That is why it should only be done by trained medical personnel.

tabs.tab_title: What should I do before and after your Laser Hair Removal treatment to ensure the best results?
tabs.tab_content:
Before your treatment

Before your laser hair removal treatment, we recommend the following:

  • Arrive at your appointment with your skin clean and free of creams, lotions and oils.
  • Shave, but do not wax.
  • Avoid sun exposure and tanning treatments.
  • Notify your specialist if you are taking any medications including antibiotics.
  • Avoid chemical peels, microdermabrasion and injectables for 14 days prior to laser hair removal.

After your treatment!

It is possible that after your treatment you may experience some redness. Don’t worry this should only go away in a few hours. The truth is that there is no downtime, so you can resume your daily activities without any problems. The hair usually falls out within two weeks. And while the hair may grow back between sessions, it is usually thinner and lighter. You will need minimal aftercare. Just please keep the treated area clean. We also recommend using a sunscreen with a minimum of SPF 30.

tabs.tab_title: How much does laser hair removal cost in Chicago?
tabs.tab_content:
Average Cost of Laser Hair Removal in Chicago

Small Areas (e.g., upper lip, chin): Starting at $30 per session. Medium Areas (e.g., bikini line, underarms): Starting at $100 per session. Large Areas (e.g., legs, back): Starting at $250 per session.

tabs.tab_title: Does Laser Really Remove Hair Permanently?
tabs.tab_content:
Laser hair removal offers long-term hair reduction, but not 100% permanent hair removal for everyone. It works by targeting hair follicles with focused light energy, which damages them and significantly reduces future hair growth.

Most clients experience a 70–90% permanent reduction in treated areas after a full series of sessions. While some fine or light hairs may return over time, they tend to grow back thinner, softer, and much less noticeable.

For best results:

  • Multiple sessions (usually 6–8) are needed.

  • Occasional maintenance treatments may be recommended.

  • Results vary depending on skin tone, hair color, and hormonal factors.

At Elite Chicago Spa, we use advanced laser technology tailored to your skin and hair type to deliver safe, effective, and lasting results.

tabs.tab_title: Can you shave in between Brazilian laser hair removal?
tabs.tab_content:
Yes, you can—and should—shave between Brazilian laser hair removal sessions, but only with certain precautions. Shaving is the only recommended method of hair removal between treatments because it doesn’t disturb the hair follicle, which is essential for laser effectiveness.

Here’s what to keep in mind:

  • Avoid waxing, plucking, or threading, as these remove the hair from the root and reduce laser effectiveness.

  • Wait at least 24 to 48 hours after each session before shaving to allow the skin to calm down.

  • Use a clean, sharp razor and shave gently to avoid irritation, especially on sensitive areas.

  • Moisturize and protect the skin afterward to reduce dryness or sensitivity.

At Elite Chicago Spa, we’ll guide you on when and how to shave safely between your sessions to help you achieve the best possible results.

tabs.tab_title: How long after laser can I shower?
tabs.tab_content:
After a laser treatment, it's recommended to wait at least 6 to 8 hours before showering, although waiting 24 hours is ideal, especially if the treated area is sensitive or red. This allows your skin time to cool down and begin the healing process without irritation.

When you do shower:

  • Use lukewarm water (never hot).

  • Avoid scrubbing, exfoliating, or using perfumed products on the treated area.

  • Pat the skin dry gently—don’t rub.

  • Avoid saunas, steam rooms, and hot tubs for at least 48 hours.

Following these guidelines helps minimize the risk of irritation, redness, or other side effects, and supports optimal results from your laser treatment.

If you're ever unsure, our specialists at Elite Chicago Spa are here to guide you through proper aftercare for your specific treatment.
